body_html:
but pytorch is ahead of us for so long, we need to have some solution. Xiaoyun
…
On Thu, Jul 12, 2018 at 7:26 AM, Asim Shankar ***@***.***> wrote: @xiaoyunwu <https://github.com/xiaoyunwu> - Unfortunately, no concrete update yet. However, the intent is to keep this in line with graph execution via the distribution strategy APIs <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/distribute> and integrate that with the tf.keras classes so that the same code works for both graph and eager execution. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. but pytorch is ahead of us for so long, we need to have some solution.

Xiaoyun
…
On Thu, Jul 12, 2018 at 7:26 AM, Asim Shankar ***@***.***> wrote:
 @xiaoyunwu <https://github.com/xiaoyunwu> - Unfortunately, no concrete
 update yet. However, the intent is to keep this in line with graph
 execution via the distribution strategy APIs
 <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/distribute>
 and integrate that with the tf.keras classes so that the same code works
 for both graph and eager execution.

 —

body:
but pytorch is ahead of us for so long, we need to have some solution.

Xiaoyun

On Thu, Jul 12, 2018 at 7:26 AM, Asim Shankar <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @xiaoyunwu <https://github.com/xiaoyunwu> - Unfortunately, no concrete
> update yet. However, the intent is to keep this in line with graph
> execution via the distribution strategy APIs
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/distribute>
> and integrate that with the tf.keras classes so that the same code works
> for both graph and eager execution.
